about_the_game:
Light years from Earth, in the Aristarchus star system (61 Cygni), powerful corporate giants rule space with an iron grip. On the moon Empedocles, your ship’s crash landing has stranded the freedom-seeking Liberty Coalition. You’ve managed to survive—but your experimental LithoBreak technology has caught the attention of VECS, the ruthless robotic enforcers who’ll stop at nothing.

Build. Repair. Survive. In LithoBreak, you’ll juggle resource management, orbital mechanics, and scientific principles to carve out a thriving colony under constant threat.

New in Stage 2

  • Building Systems – Construct buildings from hexagon modules to create factories and personal cover from incoming meteors.

  • Multiplayer – Play in co-op, letting you tackle new challenges together.

  • Metal Materials – Produce base metals and alloys with an array of smelting and refining equipment.

  • Metal Stock – Process metal ingots into a variety of stock materials (slabs, plates, sheets, ...) in the process of making metal parts.

Play with Science

LithoBreak is a survival crafting game grounded in real-world physics and engineering concepts. Whether you’re new to the genre or a science buff, you’ll find layers of complexity and authenticity.

Mine with Engineering

Every piece of equipment is visually built from the parts you produce. Materials matter:

  • Concentrate ceramics and synthesize compounds

  • Manufacture parts using the processed materials

  • Quality depends on what you use—better materials yield longer-lasting parts

  • Repair or replace broken equipment with fresh parts

  • Advance through technologies based on real methods, unlocking new materials and specialized parts that push your engineering limits

All material-processing steps are informed by real scientific principles, such as:

  • Density-based sifting of ceramic powder

  • Elemental conservation

  • Properly “energetic” thermitic reactions

Travel with Orbital Mechanics

Everything in-game is part of an orbital mechanics simulation.

  • As the days go by, the moons, planets and stars move as well.

  • Materials needing to be transferred from site to site will also utilize this mechanic to determine movement and travel times. (Stage 3)

  • Process advanced materials in zero-g manufacturing station modules (Stage 4)

  • The station was designed with engineering oversight, giving the space the feeling that someday, this could be real. (Stage 5)

Explore with Physics

LithoBreak will set the player in true-to-life sized moons to explore, with more and more features coming with each stage.

  • Create custom vehicles (Stage 3) and orbiters (Stage 4) to travel around

  • Drill beneath the moon surface and explore extensive caverns (Stage 3)

  • Explore the many moons in the Aristarchus System (Stage 4)

Join us as we strive to reclaim independence from corporate oppressors and shape the future of deep-space survival. With each stage, LithoBreak grows closer to the ultimate vision of science-driven exploration, cooperative building, and emergent storytelling.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7
  • Processor: i5-3570 3.4 GHz 4 Core
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Dedicated graphics card, GTX 770 2GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Minimum requirements may change through Early-Access
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: i7-7700 4.2 GHz 4 Core or Ryzen 7 2700
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: AMD Radeon RX 580 or Nidia GeForce GTX 1070
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 12 GB available space
  • Additional Notes: Recommendations may change through Early-Access

short_description: LithoBreak is a survival crafting game grounded in real-world physics and engineering concepts. Explore the moon surface in first person and design sprawling bases from a top-down console as rovers scurry about mining, building and repairing equipment.
